[[File:9 Manor Road.jpg|thumb|3 Manor Road]]
'''3 Manor Road''' in [[Oxford]] was the home of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Ronald]], [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]], and [[Priscilla Tolkien]] from [[1947]]<ref>{{L|107}}, p. 119</ref> to [[1950]]. They moved to this "tiny terraced house",<ref>{{L|241}}, p. 321-322</ref> owned by [[Merton College]], when their previous home, the house at [[20 Northmoor Road]] became too big and costly to maintain after the boys had moved out. 

But quite soon they found their new home too small: there was no room that Tolkien could use as a study. Tolkien stated that he typed out ''[[The Hobbit]]'' (once) and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' (twice) while sitting on a bed in the attic.<ref>{{L|257}}, p. 344</ref> Merton College promised to offer Tolkien a larger house as soon as one became available. In 1950 the Tolkiens moved to [[99 Holywell Street]].<ref>{{L|126}}, p. 140</ref>

Theologian [[:Wikipedia:Austin Farrer|Austin Farrer]] and his wife [[Katharine Farrer|Katharine]] lived in number 7 of the same street,<ref>Philip Curtis, ''A Hawk among Sparrows: A Biography of Austin Farrer'', p. 119</ref> and after the Tolkiens moved, Ronald kept correspondence with them, especially with Katharine.
